q1.question: Why does it need Accessibility permission?
q1.answer: FinderHover uses the macOS Accessibility API to detect which file your mouse is pointing at. This is the only way to track files in Finder in real-time, and all data is processed locally without being sent to any server.

q2.question: Why is Homebrew recommended?
q2.answer: Installing via Homebrew automatically handles Gatekeeper verification, saving you from manually bypassing security restrictions. Direct downloads require manual approval in System Settings → Privacy & Security.

q3.question: Which macOS versions are supported?
q3.answer: FinderHover requires macOS Sonoma 14.0 or later. We use new APIs introduced in Sonoma for better performance and stability.

q4.question: Will it affect system performance?
q4.answer: No. FinderHover uses Combine framework's debounce mechanism, only processing data when the mouse hovers. CPU usage is virtually zero. When you're not using Finder, it consumes no system resources.

setup.title: Initial Setup
setup.intro: After installing FinderHover, complete the following steps on first launch:
setup.step1: Open FinderHover from Launchpad or Applications folder
setup.step2: The app will automatically appear in the Menu Bar
setup.step3: System will prompt you to grant Accessibility permission
setup.step4: Once authorized, hover over any file in Finder to see the preview
setup.tip: You can enable "Launch at Login" in settings to have FinderHover start automatically on boot.

permissions.title: Grant Permissions
permissions.intro: FinderHover requires Accessibility permission to detect which file you're pointing at. This is a macOS security mechanism to ensure only authorized apps can access this information.
permissions.step3: Find FinderHover and toggle it on
permissions.step4: If you don't see FinderHover, click the "+" button to add it manually
permissions.warning: You may need to restart FinderHover after granting permission for it to take effect.

hover.title: Hover Preview
hover.intro: FinderHover's core feature is automatically displaying detailed file information when you hover over files in Finder.
hover.how1: Move your mouse over any file or folder in a Finder window
hover.how2: Wait for the configured delay (default 0.5 seconds)
hover.how3: Preview window appears automatically near your cursor
hover.how4: Moving to another file updates the preview content
hover.how5: Moving outside Finder or to empty space hides the preview
hover.smartIntro: FinderHover automatically detects these situations and temporarily hides the preview:

settings.title: Preferences
settings.intro: Click the menu bar icon, then select "Preferences..." or press <kbd>⌘</kbd> + <kbd>,</kbd> to open settings.
settings.hoverDelayDesc: How long to wait before showing preview (0.1 - 2.0 seconds)
settings.fontScaleDesc: Adjust text size in the preview window

styles.title: Interface Styles
styles.intro: FinderHover offers two preview window styles:
styles.macosDesc: Rich visual presentation with thumbnail preview, icons, and complete metadata. Ideal for users who need detailed file information.
styles.windowsDesc: Minimal tooltip style showing only basic information. Ideal for users who prefer a clean interface.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.noPreview1: Confirm FinderHover is running (icon should be in menu bar)
troubleshooting.noPreview4: Confirm mouse hover time exceeds the configured delay
troubleshooting.permissionTitle: Still Not Working After Granting Permission
troubleshooting.permission2: Remove FinderHover's permission in System Settings
troubleshooting.positionDesc: The preview window automatically adjusts position to avoid going off-screen. If you use multiple monitors, position issues may occur in some edge cases. Please report this issue so we can improve.
troubleshooting.stillIssueDesc: Please report issues on GitHub Issues and we'll help you as soon as possible.
